likes.disliked: — In house restaurant was a bit pricey for breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I and another couple spent 3 nights at the Listel Hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked it. The rooms were clean and comfortable; and it’s centrally located in a fun place of Vancouver. The hotel staff was especially helpful. It seems we were always asking them about how to get somewhere, or a recommendation for a restaurant. They were great.
reviews.title: Just a wonderful Hotel
What a find!
reviews.text: It’s always difficult to find a place in a city you’ve never been. I hate it when we wind up with a turkey. The Listel Hotel is a winner.

We stayed at the Listel for three nights.The ambience and the service is very good.O'Doul's restaurant is part of the hotel and there is nightly easy listening live music.The hotel is on Robson Street which is at the hub of Vancouver .If you are going on a cruise it is quite near Canada Place.
reviews.title: It's a nice place but check for Bed Bugs in your room before you settle!

likes.liked: — Location and free wireless internet in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Listel Hotel! The staff provided a warm welcome. Daily recommendations were given to us on sites to visit as well as directions and travel tips. Upon our return to the hotel, inquiries about our day ended in discussions of Vancouver and its various attractions. It was obvious the staff was proud of its city. The room was attractive, clean, and we loved the iPod dock provided so we could listen to music on our iPod in the evenings. The valet parking was prompt and worth the cost to avoid the hassel of finding parking in the city. When our car was delivered to us on the day of check out, a parting gift was left in our car - two homemade cookies and a thank you for our stay. We couldn't have asked for a better accommodation. Frommer was correct in calling The Listel Hotel a "find." We would definitely return and suggest it to our friends!!!
reviews.title: Outstanding stay at the Listel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights in June. Emailed hotel before we arrived to request a sea-view room in a quiet location, high-up with a huge double bed! Also explained it was a special wedding anniversary for us. Got an email back the next day confirming they would do their best.
reviews.title: Simply fantastic stay

likes.disliked: — Restaurant only played jazz music, but hey, I'm starting to niggle!

reviews.title: Listel is a good choice
reviews.text: Guess what, they got everything right! Room was on the top floor (6th), had a view of the harbour (I worked out only 1 or 2 rooms per floor would have this view) and the bed was enormous. To top it all, there was a tray of complimentary strawberries dipped in chocolate with a nice orchid flower plus a card wishing us happy anniversary. The team at the hotel were first class. The location is great. The double glazing ensures NO street noise is apparant. I would recommend anyone who is visiting Vancouver to try the Listel - simply fantastic!

reviews.title: Overall pretty good
reviews.text: The Listel is perfectly positioned in the vibrant Robson Street, where there is an incredible variety of restaurants. The response to my booking inquiry was very quick. I felt that they really try hard to respond quickly to requests, whatever the request might be. For me, a clean and tidy room is very important. I made good use of the Fitness Facility. I thought the price was competetive and it appears to attract the type of guest that doesn't make a noise and ruin it for the other guests. Altogether, I would certainly go back to the Listel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Trailfinders in the UK. Stayed here on the last leg of our holiday after spending over a week in California. The hotel is in a good location, on Robson Street, and the staff were efficient and quite friendly, though not overwhelmingly so (or this could just be after spending time in California where people can go over the top!). Stayed in a Museum Floor room which had a huge, comfy bed, desk, table and chair, large wardrobe with mirrored doors. Bathroom pretty pokey, actually, with sink/vanity unit outside main bathroom. No real complaints to make, everything was clean but not terribly exciting. For our "Museum" room, we had two (2) pictures on the wall which weren't exactly Picassos, but we didn't spend much time in the room.
reviews.title: A great time in Vancouver

likes.disliked: — The cost- didn't mind paying but it was expensive

reviews.title: The Listel is A Gem
reviews.text: We stayed at the Listel on August 17 for one night prior to cruising. This hotel is just gorgeous. The artwork is beautiful and added to the hotel's charm. The staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. I had booked directly on their website. I had several questions for them prior to our visit, which were answered immediately.
When we arrived, we were told we had been upgraded to a suite on the 6th floor. It was fabulous and such a nice surprise. We had a view through to the harbor where the cruise ships were coming in.
reviews.title: great location - wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The onsite restaurant -- O'Doul's was very nice. We had dinner there -- great place to watch the activity on Robson Street. And the food was terrific.
reviews.title: Love, love, love the Listel

reviews.text: This hotel is convenient to shopping, Canada Place and lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: Loved it, esp with all the free jazz

likes.disliked: — little more expensive then i hoped for but busy time so understandable

reviews.title: And they even have lighted make-up mirrors!!
reviews.text: We rented a car for the day -- valet parking is available at the hotel and we took advantage of it.

reviews.title: Very nice place, close to everything
reviews.text: I think this hotel is really nice, very central, large rooms. On my next visit I will stay at this hotel again
We stayed 5 nights (5th - 11th September) in one of the 'Museum' rooms.
reviews.title: Very pleased.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'in town' location is good, just far enough up Robson to be away from some of the hustle and bustle and, northwards, a reasonable walk down hill to Coal Harbour Seawalk.
reviews.title: Loved the Listel

likes.disliked: — Having to leave, only 1 elevator working during stay

reviews.title: Hotel with personality!
reviews.text: Reception was always highly manned, pleasant and very helpful. We thought the general ambience of the Listel was very tasteful and a very definite improvement on the corporate hotel model. Furnishings and artwork were modern and of designer quality. One slight criticism would be the limited amount of drawer space for smaller items of clothing etc.
O'Douls restaurant attached to the hotel is to be recommended. Booking, other than for breakfast, is a wise move.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at the Listel

likes.disliked: — Rooms could be upgraded a little

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights from 19 to 23 Sept 2007. Found the hotel via Expedia and booked 2 months in advance.
reviews.title: Wonderful
